faq.sectionSubtitle: Everything you need to know about our platform.

q1.question: What does the platform include?
q1.answer: Our platform covers the complete business lifecycle: lead management, proposals, contracts, invoicing, payments, double-entry accounting (PCGE & US GAAP), HR & payroll, project management with time tracking, and comprehensive financial reporting. Everything you need to run your operations in one place.

q2.question: Do you support Peruvian tax regulations (SUNAT)?
q2.answer: Yes. We fully support the Plan Contable General Empresarial (PCGE) chart of accounts, Peruvian tax calculations, and SUNAT compliance reporting. Our payroll module handles CTS, gratificaciones, and all mandatory contributions.

q3.question: Can I manage multiple companies?
q3.answer: Absolutely. With Professional and Enterprise plans, you can create and manage multiple organizations from a single account, each with its own books, chart of accounts, clients, employees, and team members.

q4.question: How does payment processing work?
q4.answer: We integrate directly with Stripe. When you send an invoice, your client receives a secure payment link. We support credit/debit cards, ACH transfers, wire payments, and cryptocurrency (USDC). Payments are automatically reconciled and journal entries created.

q5.question: Do you offer data migration?
q5.answer: Yes. Professional plans include assisted migration for your chart of accounts, clients, and historical data. Enterprise plans include white-glove migration with dedicated support to ensure a smooth transition.

q6.question: Is the platform bilingual?
q6.answer: Yes, the entire platform is fully bilingual (English and Spanish). You can switch languages at any time. All reports, invoices, and client-facing documents support both languages.

q7.question: How does the HR & Payroll module work?
q7.answer: Our HR module supports employee management, payroll processing, attendance tracking, PTO management, document handling, and contractor management. It's built for compliance in both Peru (SUNAT, EsSalud, AFP) and the US (IRS, W-2, 1099).

q8.question: What kind of support do you offer?
q8.answer: Starter plans include email support. Professional plans get priority support with faster response times. Enterprise plans include a dedicated account manager, custom onboarding, and phone support.

docs.subtitle: Comprehensive technical and product documentation for BillingOps â€” the all-in-one billing, accounting, HR, and operations platform built by Vertek.

overview.intro: BillingOps is an all-in-one billing, accounting, HR, and operations platform built by Vertek for businesses operating in Latin America and the United States. It replaces the patchwork of disconnected tools â€” spreadsheets, standalone invoicing apps, separate HR systems, and basic accounting software â€” with a single, integrated platform that covers the entire business lifecycle from the first lead to the last payment and beyond.

mission.title: Mission
mission.desc: Empower small and mid-sized businesses in Latin America and the US with a unified platform that automates billing, accounting, HR, and project management â€” eliminating operational complexity so teams can focus on growth.

market.title: Target Market
market.desc: SMBs, agencies, consulting firms, and technology companies in Peru and the United States that need a bilingual, multi-currency platform with compliance for both SUNAT (Peru) and IRS (USA) regulations.

value.title: Value Proposition
value.desc: One platform that replaces five or more disconnected tools. Automate the complete lead-to-payment pipeline, run double-entry accounting with PCGE and US GAAP support, manage HR and payroll across countries, and deliver projects with full client visibility.

differentiator.title: Key Differentiator
differentiator.desc: Purpose-built for the Latin American and US corridor. Native bilingual support (English and Spanish), multi-currency handling (PEN, USD, and more), and built-in compliance for both Peruvian and US tax regulations â€” something no other single platform offers.

overview.coreProblemDesc: BillingOps was created to address five critical pain points that businesses in our target market face every day:

problems.0: Disconnected tools: Teams juggle separate apps for CRM, invoicing, accounting, HR, and project management, leading to data silos and manual re-entry.
problems.1: No accounting for LATAM: Most cloud accounting tools lack support for the Peruvian Plan Contable General Empresarial (PCGE) and local tax compliance.
problems.2: Manual invoicing and collections: Creating invoices, sending payment links, and chasing overdue payments is time-consuming and error-prone without automation.
problems.3: Scattered HR and payroll: Managing employees across Peru and the US requires handling two different sets of labor laws, tax calculations, and compliance requirements.
problems.4: No visibility into operations: Without a unified system, business owners lack real-time dashboards and reports to make informed decisions about cash flow, project health, and team performance.

It supports the Peruvian Plan Contable General Empresarial (PCGE) and US GAAP chart of accounts out of the box, with automatic journal entry generation from business transactions across the platform.

architecture.intro: BillingOps is built on a modern, production-grade technology stack optimized for performance, developer experience, and scalability. The architecture follows established patterns for multi-tenant SaaS applications with strong data isolation, role-based access, and comprehensive audit logging.

0.name: Next.js 14 (App Router)

3.name: Prisma ORM
3.desc: Type-safe database client with schema-driven migrations, relation management, and an intuitive query builder for 80+ models.

4.name: NextAuth v5 (JWT Strategy)

8.name: next-intl for Internationalization
8.desc: Full i18n support with English and Spanish translations, locale-aware routing, and formatted dates, numbers, and currencies.

9.name: Zod Validation
9.desc: Runtime schema validation for all API inputs and form data, ensuring type safety at the boundary between client and server.

0.title: REST API Routes with Consistent Structure

1.title: RBAC Middleware with 25+ Permissions

2.title: Comprehensive Audit Logging

3.title: Multi-Tenant Data Isolation
3.desc: All database models include an organizationId field. Queries are scoped to the current organization, ensuring complete data isolation between tenants without separate databases.

security.intro: Security is foundational to BillingOps. The platform handles sensitive financial data, employee records, and business contracts, so every layer of the architecture is designed with defense in depth. Below are the key security features built into the platform.

0.title: JWT Authentication with Session Management
0.desc: NextAuth v5 with JWT strategy provides stateless authentication. Sessions include user identity and role, are cryptographically signed, and expire automatically. All authenticated routes are protected by middleware.

1.title: Role-Based Access Control (5 Roles)
1.desc: Five granular roles â€” Owner, Admin, Finance, Sales, and Viewer â€” with 25+ resource-level permissions. Every API endpoint checks permissions before executing business logic using the canAccess() utility.

2.title: Organization-Level Data Isolation
2.desc: All database queries are scoped by organizationId, ensuring complete data isolation between tenants. Users can only access data belonging to their organization, enforced at the query level.

3.title: Comprehensive Audit Logging
3.desc: Every create, update, and delete operation is recorded in the AuditLog table with actor ID, action type, entity reference, timestamp, and metadata. Provides a tamper-evident compliance trail.

4.title: Input Validation with Zod
4.desc: All API request bodies and query parameters are validated using Zod schemas before processing. Invalid inputs are rejected with detailed error messages, preventing injection attacks and data corruption.

5.title: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
5.desc: Optional two-factor authentication support for user accounts, adding an extra layer of security for accessing sensitive financial and HR data.

6.title: Password Policies
6.desc: Enforced password requirements including minimum length, complexity rules (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters), password history to prevent reuse, and configurable expiration policies.

7.title: API Keys with Scoped Permissions
7.desc: Enterprise plans support API key authentication with scoped permissions for programmatic access. Keys can be restricted to specific resources and actions, and are rotatable without downtime.

8.title: Rate Limiting
8.desc: API endpoints are protected with rate limiting to prevent abuse, brute-force attacks, and denial-of-service attempts. Limits are configurable per endpoint and per authentication level.

9.title: Encryption at Rest and in Transit
9.desc: All data is encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption in the database layer. All communications use TLS 1.3 for encryption in transit, ensuring data is protected throughout its lifecycle.

api.intro: The BillingOps API follows REST conventions with consistent authentication, authorization, validation, and response patterns across all endpoints. All routes are organized under the /api/ path and return JSON responses with standard HTTP status codes.

0.desc: List all leads with filtering and search

6.desc: Send invoice with Stripe checkout link

14.desc: Trigger dunning workflow for overdue invoices

api.authDesc: All authenticated endpoints require a valid JWT session token provided via NextAuth. The session includes the user's ID and role, which are used for RBAC permission checks. Unauthenticated requests receive a 401 response, and requests with insufficient permissions receive a 403 response.
api.publicDesc: Certain routes are accessible without authentication for client-facing workflows: proposal viewing (/api/proposals/public/[token]), contract signing (/api/contracts/public/[token]), invoice payment (/api/invoices/public/[id]), project portal (/api/projects/public/[token]), and webhook receivers (/api/webhooks/stripe, /api/webhooks/crypto).
